newsitem.title: CHINA: Yuan closes higher against dollar in Shanghai.
newsitem.headline: Yuan closes higher against dollar in Shanghai.

text.p: The Chinese yuan closed up at 8.2922 on Friday from Thursday's 8.2943 against the U.S. dollar on the Shanghai-based China foreign exchange interbank market due to reduced intervention by the central bank, traders said.
The close was the same as the weighted average price of 8.2922 on Thursday.
Dealers said buying of the yuan was more active, keeping it at higher levels while the People's Bank of China, the central bank, refrained from intervening to depress the local currency.
Intervention in the last two trading days had prevented the yuan from rising strongly despite strong pro-yuan sentiment.
